metadata.Title: CVE-2019-9633 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description: gio/gsocketclient.c in GNOME GLib 2.59.2 does not ensure that a parent GTask remains alive during the execution of a connection-attempting enumeration, which allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (g_socket_client_connected_callback mishandling and application crash) via a crafted web site, as demonstrated by GNOME Web (aka Epiphany).

notes.Note: leosilva> vulnerable code introduced in 2.59.1 see gitlab issue for more details.

criterions.comment: glib2.0: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
